pages.text: $(item)Uranium Fuel Rods$() generate Zaps and Heat. Zaps are good, $(l:ftbic:generators/nuclear/heat)Heat$() is bad.
There are three tiers of Fuel Rod, each increasing the rate that Zaps and Heat are generated.
Fuel Rods work much faster when they're next to other Fuel Rods.$(br2)Fuel Rods gain 5⚡/t per adjacent Fuel Rod. Two adjacent Fuel Rods will go from 5⚡/t each to 10⚡/t each, for a total of 20⚡/t.
pages.title: Neutron Pulse

pages.text: The tooltip in the Reactor GUI updates for adjacent Rods.
pages.title: Neutron Pulse

pages.text: However, $(c)Heat also raises dramatically$(). The equation is a bit more complex:$(br2)    $(8)n(n+1)*r$()$(br)$(li)n=amount of adjacent rods$(li)r=rod multiplier$(li2)r=2 for normal Rods$(li2)r=4 for Dual Rods$(li2)r=8 for Quad Rods
pages.title: Neutron Pulse

pages.text: $(l:ftbic:generators/nuclear/reflectors)Neutron Reflectors$() can reflect Neutron Pulses back towards the Fuel Rods that created them.
pages.title: Neutron Reflectors
